skill.name: internal-comms
skill.description: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my company likes to use. Claude should use this skill whenever asked to write some sort of internal communications (status reports, leadership updates, 3P updates, company newsletters, FAQs, incident reports, project updates, etc.).
skill.summary: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my ...
skill.author: Asmayaseen

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no code execution, no filesystem access beyond its own directory, no network calls, and no environment variable access. The verify.py script only checks for file existence. No security concerns detected.

content.value_statement: Writing clear internal communications takes time and consistency. This skill provides structured templates and guidelines for 3P updates, newsletters, FAQs, and other company communications to ensure messages are professional and easy to read.
actual_capabilities: Write 3P (Progress, Plans, Problems) updates for executives and leadership
Create company-wide newsletters with bullet-point summaries
Draft FAQ responses based on common employee questions
Format incident reports and project updates
Produce status reports with clear metrics and data
Write leadership updates following company communication style
limitations: Does not access company communication tools directly
Does not gather data from Slack, email, or calendar systems
Requires user to provide raw information and updates
Does not send or distribute communications

use_cases.title: Weekly team updates
use_cases.description: Create concise 3P updates that summarize what the team shipped, what is planned, and any blockers.

use_cases.title: Company-wide newsletters
use_cases.description: Draft monthly newsletters that highlight achievements, announcements, and cross-team progress.

use_cases.title: FAQ response guides
use_cases.description: Create standardized answers to frequently asked questions across the company.

prompt_templates.title: Weekly 3P update
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a 3P update for the Engineering team covering the past week. Include progress (shipped features, fixed bugs), plans for next week, and any problems or blockers.

prompt_templates.title: Company newsletter
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a company newsletter for the past month. Include announcements, progress on priorities, leadership updates, and social highlights. Use bullet points and keep each item to 1-2 sentences.

prompt_templates.title: FAQ response
prompt_templates.prompt: Write an FAQ response for this question: [insert question]. Provide a clear 1-2 sentence answer based on official company policy and include a link to relevant documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Status report
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a project status report for [project name]. Include current status (on track, at risk, delayed), key milestones achieved, next milestones, risks, and any help needed.

output_examples.input: Write a 3P update for the Mobile team this week.
output: Progress: Shipped push notification feature, fixed 3 critical bugs, completed Q2 planning doc
Plans: Start work on dark mode, complete performance optimization sprint, hire 2 new engineers
Problems: API latency issues blocking testing, one team member out on leave

best_practices: Keep each section to 1-3 sentences for quick reading by busy executives
Include metrics and data where possible to quantify achievements
Follow the strict formatting guidelines for each communication type
anti_patterns: Including too much detail in 3P updates intended for executives
Using company-specific jargon that new employees may not understand
Duplicating information already shared in previous communications

faq.question: What communication types does this skill support?
faq.answer: 3P updates, company newsletters, FAQ responses, status reports, leadership updates, project updates, and incident reports.

faq.question: Does this skill connect to my company tools?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides templates and guidelines. Users must provide the raw information and updates themselves.

faq.question: Can I customize the templates?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidelines can be modified to match your company communication style and specific formatting preferences.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill has no network access and does not store or transmit any data outside the conversation.

faq.question: How do I handle missing information?
faq.answer: Ask the user for clarification. The skill instructions specify gathering missing context before writing communications.

faq.question: How is this different from writing communications manually?
faq.answer: The skill provides consistent structure and formatting, ensuring all communications follow your company standards.
